intro: Amyris protium, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant wood that is highly valued in traditional medicine and perfumery. The tree has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Amyris protium is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forests and along riverbanks.
